author: Jim Collins
q_text: Good is the enemy of great.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Great vision without great people is irrelevant.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: You don't have to be the smartest person in the room to be successful.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The key is not to prioritize what's on your schedule, but to schedule your priorities.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Those who build great companies do so with a sense of purpose beyond just making money.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: You must first be who you really are, then do what you need to do.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: We live in an era of exponential change.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Greatness is not a function of circumstance. Greatness, it turns out, is largely a matter of conscious choice.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Success is a journey, not a destination.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: A great company is a company that makes a difference in the world.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The only way to achieve long-term greatness is through humility and perseverance.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Leadership is not about being in charge, it’s about taking care of those in your charge.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: We are all products of the choices we make.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: If you have the will, you will find the way.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The true test of leadership is the ability to create other leaders, not just followers.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: True greatness lies in doing the work that others are not willing to do.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Good-to-great companies have a great deal of discipline in everything they do.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: True greatness comes from being disciplined in making great decisions.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The first step in becoming great is understanding what success looks like.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Those who are able to make difficult decisions with confidence and clarity become great leaders.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: What really drives success is a relentless pursuit of excellence.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Leaders should not make excuses; they should make a plan and execute it.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Greatness requires consistency in action and thought.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The key to greatness lies in doing ordinary things extraordinarily well.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: People do not rise to the occasion, they fall to the level of their training.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The best way to predict your future is to create it.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The great companies focused on building a sustainable competitive advantage.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: It is not the strongest of the species that survive, nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The hallmark of great leadership is creating an environment where people can thrive.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: One of the most important qualities of a leader is the ability to inspire others to take action.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The best companies don’t just build products, they build relationships.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: A successful company does not operate in a vacuum; it understands the world around it.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The journey of growth is long and requires resilience and dedication.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Great companies are always thinking ahead and adapting to changes in the marketplace.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: To build a great company, you need a clear and concise vision of what you want to achieve.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: To be great, you must be willing to do what others will not do.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Success is not about how much money you make, but the impact you have on others.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Great leaders understand that there is no such thing as a one-man show.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Success requires relentless effort and the ability to handle setbacks gracefully.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Building a great company requires patience and discipline over a long period of time.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: You can never go wrong by doing the right thing.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The best organizations are those that treat their people with respect and encourage collaboration.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: A great organization is one that helps people become the best versions of themselves.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Leaders must make tough decisions, but they must do so with empathy and compassion.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: True greatness comes from working hard for something worth achieving.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Your choices today will determine your success tomorrow.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Every great leader has the ability to rise above challenges and learn from them.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The key to enduring greatness is finding a balance between perseverance and flexibility.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The foundation of any successful organization is trust, collaboration, and respect.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Greatness comes from making decisions that are rooted in both heart and mind.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The secret to success is not being afraid to fail, but rather to keep moving forward despite failure.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: Success is a byproduct of doing what you love and doing it well.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: In the pursuit of greatness, consistency is the ultimate key.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: You don’t have to have all the answers; you just need the right questions.

author: Jim Collins
q_text: The most successful organizations are those that are committed to constant learning and growth.
